verses.text: So Moses cried out to the Lord: “What am I to do with these people? Just a little more and they’ll stone me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses, “Go over in front of the people and take some of the elders of Israel with you. Take in your hand the staff with which you struck the Nile, and go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll be standing there in front of you on the rock at Horeb. You are to strike the rock and water will come out of it, so the people can drink.” Moses did this in front of the elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He named the place Massah and Meribah, because the Israelis quarreled and tested the Lord by saying: “Is the Lord really among us or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, the Amalekites came and fought with the Israelis at Rephidim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told Joshua, “Choose some men for us and go out to fight against the Amalekites. Tomorrow I’ll stand on top of the hill with the staff of God in my hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua did as Moses told him and fought against the Amalekites, while Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever Moses raised his hand, the Israelis prevailed, but when his hand remained at his side, then the Amalekites prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses’ hands became heavy, they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat on it. Aaron and Hur supported his hands, one on one side and one on the other, and so his hands were steady until the sun went down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua defeated Amalek and his army using swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses, “Write this in a book as a memorial and recite it to Joshua: ‘I’ll certainly wipe out the memory of the Amalekites from under heaven.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses built an altar and named it “The Lord is My Banner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Because,” he said, “a fist has been raised in defiance against the throne of the Lord, the Lord will wage war against Amalek from generation to generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard all that God had done for Moses and for his people Israel, and how the Lord had brought Israel out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, had taken back Moses’ wife Zipporah after she had been sent away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with her two sons. The name of the one was Gershom, because he would say, “I was an alien in a foreign land,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while the name of the other was Eliezer, because he would say, “My father’s God helped me and delivered me from Pharaoh’s sword.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses’ father-in-law Jethro, together with Moses’ two sons and his wife, came to Moses in the desert where he was camped at the mountain of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you along with your wife and her two sons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, he bowed low and kissed him, and they greeted one another. Then they went into the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told his father-in-law all that the Lord had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians on Israel’s behalf, all the hardships that they had encountered along the way, and how the Lord had delivered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro rejoiced over all the good that the Lord had done for Israel in delivering them from the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro said, “Blessed be the Lord, who delivered you from the hand of the Egyptians and from the hand of Pharaoh, and who delivered the people from the oppression of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I know that the Lord is greater than all other gods, because of what happened to the Egyptians when they acted arrogantly against Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought a burnt offering and sacrifices for God, and Aaron and all the elders of Israel came to dine with Moses’ father-in-law in the presence of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day Moses sat down to judge the people, and the people stood around Moses from morning until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he was doing for the people, he said, “What is this that you are doing for the people? Why do you alone sit as judge, with all the people standing around you from morning until evening?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told his father-in-law, “Because the people come to me to seek God’s will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they have a dispute, it comes to me and I decide between a person and his neighbor, and make known the statutes of God and his instructions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses’ father-in-law told him, “What you are doing is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will certainly wear yourself out, both you and these people who are with you, because the task is too heavy for you. You cannot do it by yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now listen to me. I’ll advise you, and may God be with you. You are to represent the people before God and bring the disputes to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to teach them the statutes and instructions and make known to them the way they’re to go and the things they’re to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to look for capable men among the people, men who fear God, men of integrity who hate dishonest gain. You are to set these men over them as officials over thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to judge the people at all times. Let them bring every major matter to you, but let them judge every minor matter. It will lighten your burden, and they’ll bear it with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do this, and God so commands you, you will be able to stand the strain, and all these people will also go to their homes in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses listened to his father-in-law and did everything he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses chose capable men from all Israel and appointed them as heads over the people, as officials over thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They judged the people at all times; the difficult matters they brought to Moses, but every minor matter they judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent his father-in-law on his way, and he went to his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third New Moon after the Israelis went out of the land of Egypt, on that very day, they came to the desert of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had set out from Rephidim and arrived at the desert of Sinai where they camped in the desert. Israel camped there in front of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went up to God, and the Lord called to him from the mountain: “This is what you are to say to the house of Jacob and declare to the sons of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You saw what I did to the Egyptians, and how I carried you on eagles’ wings and brought you to myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now if you carefully obey me and keep my covenant, you are to be my special possession out of all the nations, because the whole earth belongs to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you are to be a kingdom of priests and a holy nation to me.’ These are the words you are to declare to the Israelis.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses came, he summoned the elders of the people and told them everything that the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the people answered together: “We’ll do everything that the Lord has said!”
Then Moses reported all the words of the people back to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “Look, I’m coming to you in a thick cloud, so that the people may listen when I speak with you and always believe you.” Moses reported the words of the people to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “Go to the people and consecrate them today and tomorrow. They must wash their clothes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and be ready for the third day, for on the third day the Lord will come down on Mount Sinai in the sight of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to set boundaries for the people all around: ‘Be very careful that you don’t go up on the mountain or touch the side of it. Anyone who touches the mountain is certainly to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No hand is to touch that person, but he is certainly to be stoned or shot; whether animal or person, he is not to live.’ They are to approach the mountain only when the ram’s horn sounds a long blast.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses went down from the mountain to the people, he consecrated the people, and they washed their clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told the people, “Be ready for the third day; don’t go near a woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When morning came on the third day, there was thunder and lightning, with a heavy cloud over the mountain, and the very loud sound of a ram’s horn. All the people in the camp trembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses brought the people from the camp to meet God, and they stood at the base of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mount Sinai was completely enveloped in smoke because the Lord had come down in fire on it. Smoke went up from it like smoke from a kiln, and the whole mountain shook violently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the sound of the ram’s horn grew louder and louder, Moses would speak and God would answer with thunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord came down on Mount Sinai to the top of the mountain, he summoned Moses to the top of the mountain, and Moses went up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “Go down and warn the people so they don’t break through to look at the Lord, and many of them perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the priests who approach the Lord must consecrate themselves. Otherwise, the Lord will attack them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told the Lord, “The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai because you warned us: ‘Set boundaries around the mountain and consecrate it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told him, “Go down, and come back up with Aaron, but the priests and the people must not break through to go up to the Lord. Otherwise, he will attack them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went down to the people and spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God spoke all these words:א
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt— from the house of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to have no other gods as a substitute for me.ב
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to craft for yourselves an idol or anything resembling what is in the skies above, or on earth beneath, or in the water sources under the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to bow down to them in worship or serve them, because I, the Lord your God, am a jealous God, visiting the guilt of parents on children, to the third and fourth generation of those who hate me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but showing gracious love to the thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.ג
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to misuse the name of the Lord your God, because the Lord will not leave unpunished the one who misuses his name.ד
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember the Sabbath day, maintaining its holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you are to labor and do all your work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God. You are not to do any work—neither you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male or female servant, nor your livestock, nor any foreigner who lives among you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Lord made the heavens, the earth, the sea, and everything that is in them in six days. Then he rested on the seventh day. Therefore, the Lord blessed the Sabbath day and made it holy.ה
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Honor your father and your mother, so that you may live long in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.ו
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to commit murder.ז
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to commit adultery.ח
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to steal.ט
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to give false testimony against your neighbor.י
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to desire your neighbor’s house, nor your neighbor’s wife, his male or female servant, his ox, his donkey, nor anything else that pertains to your neighbor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people experienced the thunder and lightning, the sound of the ram’s horn, and the smoking mountain. And as the people experienced it, they trembled and stood at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told Moses, “You speak to us and we will listen, but don’t let God speak with us, or we may die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told the people, “Don’t be afraid, for God has come to test you, so that you may fear him in order that you don’t sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people stood at a distance, and Moses approached the thick cloud where God was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “This is what you are to say to the Israelis, ‘You have seen for yourselves that I spoke to you from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to make gods of silver alongside me, nor are you to make for yourselves gods of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make an altar of earth for me, and you are to sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and peace offerings, your sheep, and your cattle. Everywhere I cause my name to be remembered, I’ll come to you and bless you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you make an altar of stone for me, you must not build it of cut stones, because if you strike it with your chisel, you will profane it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to ascend to my altar on steps, so that your nakedness may not be exposed on it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the ordinances that you are to set before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you acquire a Hebrew servant, he is to serve for six years, and in the seventh he is to go out a free man without paying anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he came in by himself, he is to go out by himself. If he was married, his wife is to go out with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If his master gives him a wife and she bears him sons or daughters, the wife and children belong to her master, and he is to go out by himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the servant, in fact, says, ‘I love my master, my wife, and my children, and I won’t go out a free man,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his master is to bring him before the judges and he is to bring him to the door or to the doorpost. His master is to pierce his ear with an awl, and he is to serve him permanently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a man sells his daughter as a servant, she won’t go out as the male servants do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If she’s displeasing to her master who selected her for himself, he must let her be redeemed. He does not have the right to sell her to foreign people, because he has dealt unfairly with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he has selected her for his son, he is to treat her according to the ordinance for daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he takes another woman for himself, he may not withhold from the first her food, her clothing, or her marital rights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he does not do these three things for her, she may go out without paying anything at all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever strikes a man so that he dies is certainly to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he didn’t lie in wait, but God let him fall into his reach, then I’ll appoint for you a place to which he may flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man acts deliberately against his neighbor, to kill him by treachery, you are to take him to die even if he’s at my altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever strikes his father or his mother is certainly to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever kidnaps a person, whether he has sold him or whether the victim is still in his possession, is certainly to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever curses his father or his mother is certainly to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If people quarrel and one strikes the other with a rock or his fist, and he does not die but ends up in bed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the injured person then gets up and walks around outside with the help of his staff, the one who struck him is not liable, except that he is to compensate him for his loss of time and take care of his complete recovery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man strikes his male or female servant with a stick and he or she dies as a direct result, the master must be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the servant survives a day or two, the master is not to be punished because the servant is his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If two men are fighting and they strike a pregnant woman and her children are born prematurely, but there is no harm, he is certainly to be fined as the husband of the woman demands of him, and he will pay as the court decides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is harm, then you are to require life for life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: burn for burn, wound for wound, and bruise for bruise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man strikes the eye of his male or female servant and destroys it, he is to release him as a free man in exchange for his eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he knocks out the tooth of his male or female servant, he is to release him as a free man in exchange for his tooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If an ox gores a man or woman so that they die, the ox is certainly to be stoned and its flesh may not be eaten, but the owner of the ox is free from liability.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the ox has gored previously, and its owner has been warned about it but didn’t restrain it, and it kills a man or woman, the ox is to be stoned and its owner also is to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a fine is imposed on him, he may pay all that was imposed on him as a ransom for his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This same ordinance applies if it gores a son or daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the ox gores a male or female servant, the owner is to give 30 shekels of silver to the servant’s master, and the ox is to be stoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man opens a pit or digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or donkey falls into it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the owner of the pit is to make restitution. He is to pay money to its owner, and the dead animal will become his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man’s ox strikes his neighbor’s ox and it dies, they are to sell the live ox and divide the money. They also are to divide the dead animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it was known that the ox had gored previously, and its owner didn’t restrain it, he is certainly to repay ox for ox, and the dead ox is to become his.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man steals an ox or sheep and slaughters it or sells it, he is to repay five oxen for the ox and four sheep for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a thief is found while breaking into a house, and is struck down and dies, it is not a capital crime in that case,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if the sun has risen on him, then it is a capital crime in that case. A thief is certainly to make restitution, but if he has nothing, he is to be sold for his theft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If what was stolen is actually found alive in his possession, whether an ox, a donkey or a sheep, he is to repay double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a man lets a field or vineyard be grazed over or releases his livestock so that they graze in another man’s field, he is to make restitution from the best of his field or vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a fire breaks out and spreads into thorn bushes and consumes stacked grain or standing grain or the field, the one who started the fire certainly is to make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a man gives his neighbor money or goods for safekeeping and it’s stolen from the neighbor’s house, the thief, if found, is to repay double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the thief is not found, the owner of the house is to appear before the judges to see whether or not the thief took his neighbor’s property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In every ownership dispute involving an ox, donkey, sheep, garment, or anything that is lost where a person says, ‘This is mine,’ the case between the two of them is to come before the judges, and the one that the judges declare guilty is to repay double to his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a man gives a donkey, ox, sheep, or any animal to his neighbor for safe keeping, and it dies or is injured or is driven away when no one is looking,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the two of them are to take an oath in the Lord’s presence that the accused has not taken his neighbor’s property. Its owner is to accept this, and the neighbor is not to make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it was actually stolen from him, the neighbor is to make restitution to its owner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it was torn to pieces, let the neighbor bring the remains as evidence, and he is not to make restitution for what was torn apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a man borrows an animal from his neighbor, and it’s injured or dies while its owner was not with it, he is certainly to make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If its owner was with it, he is not to make restitution. If it was hired, its fee covers the loss.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a man seduces a virgin who is not engaged to be married and has sexual relations with her, he must pay her bride price, and she is to become his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her father absolutely refuses to give her to him, he is to pay an amount equal to the bride price for virgins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to allow a sorceress to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever has sexual relations with an animal is certainly to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Anyone who sacrifices to a god, except the Lord alone, is to be utterly destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to wrong or oppress an alien, because you were aliens in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to mistreat any widow or orphan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do mistreat them, they’ll certainly cry out to me, and I’ll immediately hear their cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I’ll be angry and will kill you with swords, and your wives will become widows and your children orphans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you loan money to my people, to the poor among you, don’t be like a creditor to them and don’t impose interest on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you take your neighbor’s coat as collateral, you are to return it to him by sunset,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it’s his only covering; it’s his outer garment, for what else can he sleep in? And when he cries out to me, I’ll hear him, for I am gracious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to blaspheme God or curse a ruler of your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to hold back the fullness of your harvest and the outflow of your wine presses. You are to give to me the firstborn of your sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to do the same with your oxen and your sheep. They are to be with their mother for seven days and then on the eighth day you are to give them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to be people set apart for me. You are not to eat flesh torn apart in the field; you are to throw it to the dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to spread a false report, nor are you to join forces with the wicked to be a malicious witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to follow the majority in doing wrong, and you are not to testify in a lawsuit so as to follow the majority and pervert justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to show partiality to a poor man in his lawsuit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you come across your enemy’s ox or donkey wandering off, you are to certainly return it to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you see your enemy’s donkey lying helpless under its load, you must not abandon it; rather, you are certainly to return it to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to pervert justice for the poor among you in their lawsuits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay far away from a false charge, and don’t kill the innocent or the righteous, because I won’t acquit the guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to take a bribe because a bribe blinds the clear-sighted and distorts the words of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to oppress the resident alien, because you were aliens in the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to sow your land and gather its crops for six years,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you are to let it rest the seventh year, leaving it unplanted. The poor of your people may eat from it, and the wild animals may eat what they leave. You are to do the same with your vineyards and olive groves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to do your work for six days, but on the seventh day you are to refrain from work so that your ox and donkey may rest, and so the son of your maidservant and the alien may be refreshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be careful about everything I’ve told you, and don’t mention the name of other gods. Don’t let them be heard in your mouth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Three times a year you are to celebrate a festival for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to observe the Festival of Unleavened Bread. As I commanded you, you are to eat unleavened bread for seven days at the appointed time in the month Abib, because in it you came out of Egypt. No one is to appear before me empty handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to observe the Festival of Harvest, celebrating the first fruits of your work in planting the field, and the Festival of Tabernacles at the end of the year, when you gather the fruit of your work from the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times a year all your males are to appear in the presence of the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to offer the blood of my sacrifice with anything leavened, and you are not to let the fat portion of my sacrifice remain overnight until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are to bring the best of the first fruits of your soil to the house of the Lord your God.
“You are not to boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look, I’m sending an angel in front of you to guard you on the way and to bring you to the place I’ve prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful! Be sure to obey him. Don’t rebel against him, because he won’t forgive your transgression, since my Name is in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, if you carefully obey him and do everything that I say, then I’ll be an enemy to your enemies and an adversary to your adversaries,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because my angel will go ahead of you and will bring you to the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, and I’ll annihilate them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to bow down to their gods or serve them. You are not to follow their practices, but you are to overthrow them completely and smash their sacred stones to pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to serve the Lord your God, and he will bless your food and water, and I’ll remove sickness from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No woman will miscarry or be barren in your land, and I’ll make every day of your life complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’ll go ahead of you and terrorize all the people to whom you are coming. I’ll confuse your enemies and make them turn their backs on you and run away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll send hornets ahead of you and they’ll drive out the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I won’t drive them out before you in a single year, so that the land does not become desolate and so that wild animals do not overrun you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll drive them out ahead of you little by little until you increase in numbers and possess the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’ll set your borders from the Reed Sea to the Sea of the Philistines, and from the desert to the Euphrates River, bringing the inhabitants of the land under your control, and you are to drive them out ahead of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to make a covenant with them or with their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are not to live in your land. Otherwise they will cause you to sin against me. If you worship their gods, it will become a snare for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “Come up to the Lord, you and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and 70 of the elders of Israel, and worship at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only Moses is to approach the Lord, but the others are not to approach; the people are not to come up with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses came and reported all the words of the Lord and all the statutes to the people, and they all answered with one voice, “We will do everything that the Lord has decreed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses wrote down all the words of the Lord. He got up early in the morning and built an altar with twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel at the base of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent young Israeli men to offer up burnt offerings and sacrifice bulls as peace offerings to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses took half the blood and put it in bowls, while he sprinkled the other half on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the Book of the Covenant and read it to the people. They said, “We will put into practice and obey everything that the Lord has decreed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses took the blood, sprinkled it on the people, and said, “This is the blood of the covenant that the Lord made with you based on all these words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and 70 of the elders of Israel went up
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saw the God of Israel. Under his feet was something like a pavement made of sapphire, as clear as the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because God did not punish the Israeli leaders, they looked at God, yet lived to eat and drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses, “Go up to me on the mountain and stay there. I’ll give you stone tablets with the instruction and law that I’ve written to teach the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses got up, along with Joshua his servant, and went up on the mountain of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told the elders, “Wait here for us until we return to you. Look, Aaron and Hur are with you, and whoever has a dispute, let him come to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses went up on the mountain, the cloud covered it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The glory of the Lord settled on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for six days. Then on the seventh day he called to Moses from within the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the Israelis the appearance of the glory of the Lord was like a consuming fire on top of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses went up on the mountain, he went into the center of the cloud and was on the mountain for 40 days and 40 nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis to take an offering for me, and you are to accept my offering from every person whose heart moves him to give.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the offering that you are to accept from them: gold, silver, and bronze;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blue, purple, and scarlet material; fine linen and goat hair;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ram skins dyed red, dolphin skins, and acacia wood;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: oil for lighting, spices for the anointing oil and for aromatic incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and onyx stones, stones for setting on the ephod and the breast piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them make a sanctuary for me so I may live among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how you are to make it: according to all that I’m showing you, according to the pattern for the tent and the pattern for all its furnishings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They are to make an ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, one and a half cubits wide, and one and a half cubits high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to overlay it with pure gold—you are to overlay it inside and outside—and you are to make a gold molding around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to cast four rings for it and put them on its four feet, two rings on one side of it and two rings on its other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark with which to carry it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poles are to remain in the rings of the ark and are not to be removed from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the Testimony that I will give you into the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make a Mercy Seat of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and one and a half cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make two cherubim of gold; you are to make them of hammered work at the two ends of the Mercy Seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Place one cherub at one end and one cherub at the other end. You are to make the cherubim at the two ends of the Mercy Seat, and of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cherubim are to spread their wings upward, covering the Mercy Seat with their wings and facing each other. The faces of the cherubim is to be turned toward the Mercy Seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the Mercy Seat on top of the ark, and put the Testimony that I’ll give you into the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll meet with you there, and I’ll tell you all my commandments for the Israelis from above the Mercy Seat, from between the two cherubim that are on the Ark of the Testimony.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make a table of acacia wood, two cubits long, a cubit wide, and one and a half cubits high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to overlay it with pure gold, and put a gold molding around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make a rim one handbreadth in width around it, and you are to make a gold molding around the rim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make four gold rings for it, and put the rings on the four corners where its four feet are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rings are to be close to the rim as holders for the poles to carry the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold so the table can be carried with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make its plates, dishes, jars, and bowls from which libations will be poured, and you are to make them of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the bread of the Presence on the table before me continuously.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make a lamp stand of pure gold: the lamp stand and its base and stem are to be of hammered work, and its cups, calyxes, and flowers are to be of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six branches are to extend from its sides, three branches of the lamp stand from one side of it and three branches of the lamp stand from its other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three cups shaped like almond blossoms with calyxes and flowers are to be on one branch and three cups shaped like almond blossoms with calyxes and flowers are to be on the other branch, and so for the six branches extending from the lamp stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the lamp stand itself there are to be four cups shaped like almond blossoms with their calyxes and flowers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A calyx is to be under the two branches that extend out of the stem; a calyx is to be under the next pair of branches that extend out of the stem; and a calyx is to be under the last pair of branches that extend out of the stem, and so for the six branches extending from the lamp stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their calyxes and their branches are to be of one piece with it; all of it is to be made of one piece of hammered work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make seven lamps for it, and its lamps are to be mounted so as to give light in front of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its tongs and trays are to be of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lamp stand—together with all its furnishings—is to be made from a talent of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now see that you make them according to the pattern for them which you are being shown on the mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make the tent with ten curtains of fine woven linen and with blue, purple, and scarlet material. You are to make them with cherubim skillfully worked into them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain is to be 28 cubits, the width of each curtain four cubits, and all the curtains are to have the same measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Five of the curtains are to be joined together, and the other five curtains are to be joined together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make loops of blue material along the edge of the outermost curtain in the first set, and likewise you are to make loops along the edge of the outermost curtain in the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make 50 loops in the one curtain, and you are to make 50 loops along the edge of the curtain that is in the second set, with the loops opposite each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you are to make 50 gold clasps, and join the curtains to each other with the clasps so that the tent will be one piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make curtains of goat hair for a tent over the tent. You are to make eleven curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain is to be 30 cubits, and the width of each curtain two cubits; the measurements of each of the eleven curtains is to be the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to join five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves, and you are to double over the sixth curtain at the front of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make 50 loops along the edge of the outermost curtain in the first set, and 50 loops along the edge of the curtain of the other set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make 50 bronze clasps, put the clasps into the loops, and join the tent together so that it will be one piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the excess that remains of the curtains of the tent—the half curtain that remains—is to hang over the back of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The half cubit that remain on either end of the length of the curtains of the tent is to hang over each side of the tent to cover it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make a cover for the tent of ram skins dyed red and a covering of dolphin skins above that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make upright boards of acacia wood for the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each board is to be ten cubits long and one and a half cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each board is to have two pegs joined to one another, and you are to do this for all the boards of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make the boards for the tent: 20 boards for the south side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you are to make 40 silver sockets under the 20 boards: two sockets under the one board for its two pegs and two sockets under the next board for its two pegs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the second side of the tent to the north you are to make 20 boards
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and 40 silver sockets for them, two sockets under one board and two sockets under the next board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the west you are to make six boards for the rear of the tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you are to make two boards for the rear corners of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to be interlocked together at the bottom and connected on top by one ring. Do this for the two of them, and they are to be the two corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is to be eight boards with their sixteen silver sockets, two sockets under one board and two sockets under the next board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make bars of acacia wood, five for the boards on one side of the tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: five bars for the boards on the second side of the tent, and five bars for the boards on the back side of the tent to the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The center bar in the middle of the boards is to pass through from end to end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to overlay the boards with gold, and you are to make gold rings for them as holders for the bars, and you are to overlay the bars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to erect the tent according to the plan for it that was shown you on the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make a curtain of blue, purple, and scarlet material, and fine woven linen. You are to make it with cherubim skillfully worked into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to hang it on four pillars of acacia overlaid with gold, which have hooks of gold, and are set on four sockets of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to hang the curtain from the clasps and bring the Ark of the Testimony there inside the curtain. The curtain is to separate for you the Holy Place from the Most Holy Place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to put the Mercy Seat on the Ark of the Testimony in the Most Holy Place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the table outside the curtain. You are to put the table on the north side with the lamp stand opposite the table on the south side of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the doorway of the tent you are to make a screen of blue, purple, and scarlet material, and with fine woven linen, the work of an embroiderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make five pillars of acacia for the screens and overlay them with gold. Their hooks are to be of gold, and you are to cast five bronze sockets for them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make the altar of acacia wood. It is to be five cubits long and five cubits wide; the altar is to be a square, and it is to be three cubits high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make horns on its four corners. Its corners are to be of one piece with it, and you are to overlay it with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make pans for removing its ashes, shovels, bowls, forks, and fire-pans for it, and you are to make all its utensils of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make a lattice, a netting of bronze for it, and you are to make four bronze rings on the netting at its four corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put it under the ledge of the altar, so that the netting extends halfway up the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and you are to overlay them with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poles for it are to be put through the rings, so the poles are on the two sides of the altar when it’s carried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make it hollow out of boards—just as it was shown you on the mountain, that’s how they are to make it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make the court of the tent. On the south side there is to be hangings of fine woven linen for the court, 100 cubits long on one side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is to have 20 pillars, with 20 bronze sockets, and the hooks of the pillars and their bands are to be made of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise for the length of the north side there are to be hangings 100 cubits long, and it is to have 20 pillars with 20 bronze sockets, and the hooks of the pillars and their bands are to be made of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The width of the court on the west side is to have hangings 50 cubits long with ten pillars and ten sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The width of the court on the east side is to be 50 cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hangings for the one section are to be fifteen cubits long, with their three pillars and three sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the second section there are to be hangings of fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and three sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is to be a screen of 20 cubits of blue, purple, and scarlet material and fine woven linen, the work of an embroiderer, for the gate of the court, and it is to have four pillars and four sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the pillars around the court are to be banded with silver. Their hooks are to be made of silver and their sockets made of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of the court is to be 100 cubits, the width 50 cubits, and the height five cubits, with the hangings of fine woven linen, and the sockets of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the utensils of the tent for its service, all its pegs, and all the pegs for the court are to be made of bronze.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you are to command the Israelis to bring you pure olive oil, extracted by hand, for the light in order to keep the lamp burning continuously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the Tent of Meeting, outside the curtain that is before the Testimony, Aaron and his sons are to maintain the lamp stand from evening until morning in the Lord’s presence. It is to be a perpetual ordinance from generation to generation among the Israelis.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to bring your brother Aaron, along with his sons, from among the Israelis so they can serve as priests for me: that is, Aaron and his sons Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make holy garments for Aaron your brother, for dignity and beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to speak to all who are skilled, whom I’ve endowed with talent, that they should make Aaron’s garments for consecrating him to serve me as priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the garments that they are to make: a breast piece, an ephod, a robe, a checkered tunic, a turban, and a sash. They are to make holy garments for Aaron your brother and for his sons to serve me as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to use gold, blue, purple, and scarlet material, as well as fine linen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They are to make the ephod from gold, along with blue, purple, and scarlet material and fine woven linen, all of it skillfully worked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is to have two shoulder-pieces attached to its two edges so it can be joined together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The skillfully woven band that is on it is to be made like it, that is, of one piece with it, of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet material, and fine woven linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to take two onyx stones and engrave the names of the sons of Israel on them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: six of their names on one stone, and the six remaining names on the other stone. Engrave them according to their order of birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With work like a jeweler engraves on a signet, you are to inscribe the two stones with the names of the sons of Israel, and you are to mount them in settings of gold filigree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the two stones on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as stones of remembrance representing the sons of Israel, and Aaron is to carry their names into the Lord’s presence on his two shoulders as a memorial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make settings of gold filigree,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you are to make two chains of pure gold twisted like cords, and then fasten the twisted chains to the filigree settings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make a breast piece to be worn by the high priest when he makes legal decisions. It is to be skillfully worked, made like the work of the ephod from gold, blue, purple, and scarlet material, and from fine woven linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is to be square when folded double, one hand span long and one hand span wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to mount on it a setting for four rows of stones. The first row is to contain carnelian, topaz, and emerald;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the second row ruby, sapphire, and crystal;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third row jacinth, agate, and amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fourth row beryl, onyx, and jasper, and they are to be set in gold filigree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stones are to correspond to the names of the sons of Israel, twelve stones corresponding to their names. They are to be engraved like a signet, each with the name of one of the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make chains of pure gold, twisted like cords, for the breast piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make two gold rings for the breast piece, and put the two rings on the two edges of the breast piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the two gold cords on the two gold rings at the edges of the breast piece,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you are to attach the other two ends of the two cords to the filigree settings and attach them to the shoulder pieces of the ephod in front.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make two gold rings and attach them to the two edges of the breast piece, on the side of it that is toward the inner side of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make two gold rings and attach them in front on the lower part of the two shoulder pieces of the ephod close to the place where it’s joined, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to fasten the rings on the breast piece to the rings on the ephod with a blue cord so it will rest on the skillfully woven band of the ephod and so the breast piece won’t come loose from the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Aaron is to carry the names of Israel’s sons on his heart on the breast piece to be worn by the high priest when he makes legal decisions, that is, whenever he goes into the Holy Place in order to remember them continuously in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the Urim and Thummim into the breast piece of judgment, and they are to be on Aaron’s heart when he goes into the Lord’s presence. He is to carry the breast piece of decision that depicts Israel’s sons on his heart in the Lord’s presence continuously.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make the robe of the ephod entirely of blue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is to be an opening at its top, in the middle, with a woven binding around the opening like the opening of a coat of mail so that it cannot be torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On its hem you are to make blue and purple and scarlet pomegranates, all around the skirt, with gold bells between them all the way around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to have a gold bell and a pomegranate, then a gold bell and a pomegranate, on the hem of the robe all the way around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron is to wear the robe when he ministers so its sound may be heard when he enters and leaves the Holy Place in the Lord’s presence, so that he won’t die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make a medallion of pure gold, and engrave on it ‘Holy to the Lord,’ like the engravings of a signet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put it on a blue cord and place it on the turban. It is to be on the front of the turban
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and worn on Aaron’s forehead in order to take away any guilt contained in the holy things which the Israelis consecrate as holy gifts. It is to remain on his forehead continuously, so they may be accepted in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to weave the checkered tunic of fine linen, you are to make a turban of fine linen, and you are to make an embroidered sash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make tunics for the sons of Aaron, you are to make sashes for them, and you are to make head coverings for them for dignity and beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put them on Aaron your brother, and on his sons with him, and you are to anoint them, ordain them, and consecrate them to serve as my priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make linen undergarments for them to cover their naked flesh, and they are to reach from the loins to the thighs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to be on Aaron and his sons when they enter the Tent of Meeting or when they approach the altar to minister in the Holy Place so they don’t incur guilt and die. This is to be a perpetual ordinance for him and for his descendants after him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what you are to do to them in order to consecrate them to serve me as priests: Take a young bull, two rams without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil, which you are to make from fine wheat flour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put them in one basket and bring them in the basket along with the bull and the two rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to bring Aaron and his sons to the doorway of the Tent of Meeting, and wash them with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the garments and clothe Aaron with the tunic, the robe of the ephod, the ephod, and the breast piece, and then gird him with the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then put the turban on his head, and place the holy crown on the turban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to take the anointing oil, pour it on his head, and anoint him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you are to bring his sons and clothe them with tunics.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to gird Aaron and his sons with sashes and tie headdresses on them. The priesthood is to belong to them by perpetual ordinance, and you are to ordain Aaron and his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to bring the bull in front of the Tent of Meeting, and Aaron and his sons are to lay their hands on the head of the bull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you are to slaughter the bull in the Lord’s presence at the doorway of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take some of the blood of the bull, put it on the horns of the altar with your finger, and pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to take all the fat that covers the entrails, the lobe of the liver, the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them and send them up in smoke on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to burn the flesh of the bull, its hide, and its refuse with fire outside the camp. It is a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to take one of the rams, and Aaron and his sons are to lay their hands on its head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you are to slaughter the ram, take its blood, and scatter it around the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to cut the ram into pieces, wash its entrails and legs, put them on the altar along with the pieces and its head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and send up the whole ram in smoke on the altar. It is a burnt offering to the Lord; it’s a soothing aroma, an offering by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons are to lay their hands on the head of the ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to slaughter the ram, take some of its blood, and put it on the lobe of Aaron’s right ear, the lobe of his sons’ right ears, the thumbs of their right hands, and the big toes of their right feet. Then you are to scatter the rest of the blood around the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to take some of the blood which is on the altar, along with some of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it on Aaron and his garments, and on his sons and their garments. He is to be consecrated with his garments, along with his sons and their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to take the fat from the ram, the fat tail, the fat that covers the entrails, the lobe of the liver, the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, the right thigh (for it’s a ram of ordination),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one loaf of bread, one cake of bread mixed with oil, and one wafer out of the basket of unleavened bread that is in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put all of these in the hands of Aaron and in the hands of his sons, and present them as a wave offering in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you are to take them from their hands and send them up in smoke on the altar on top of the burnt offering for a soothing aroma in the Lord’s presence. It is an offering by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to take the breast of the ram of Aaron’s ordination, and present it as a wave offering in the Lord’s presence, and it is to be your portion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to consecrate the portion of the ram of ordination that belongs to Aaron and his sons: the breast of the wave offering that was waved and the thigh of the presented offering that was presented.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These offerings from the Israelis are to be a perpetual ordinance for Aaron and his sons. They are presented offerings, and they are to be presented offerings from the Israelis out of their peace offerings. They are presented offerings to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The holy garments of Aaron are to be for his sons after him so that they may be anointed in them and ordained in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron’s son, who is priest in his place, is to wear them for seven days when he comes into the Tent of Meeting to minister in the Holy Place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in a Holy Place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron and his sons are to eat the flesh of the ram along with the bread that is in the basket at the doorway of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to eat these things by which atonement was made at their ordination to consecrate them, but an unqualified person is not to eat because these things are holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any of the flesh of the ordination ram or any of the bread is left until morning, you are to burn what is left with fire. Because it’s holy, what remains is not to be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to do this for Aaron and his sons, just as I’ve commanded you. You are to ordain them for seven days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every day you are to offer a bull as a sin offering for atonement. Offer the sin offering on the altar when you make atonement for it and anoint the altar to consecrate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make atonement for the altar for seven days and consecrate it. It will be most holy, and whatever touches it will be holy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what you are to offer on the altar continually: two one year old lambs each day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to offer one lamb in the morning and the other at twilight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there is to be a tenth measure of choice flour mixed with one fourth of a hin of oil extracted by hand, and one fourth of a hin of wine as a drink offering for one lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to offer the other lamb at twilight with the same grain offering and drink offering as in the morning. You are to offer it as a soothing aroma, an offering by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is to be a regular burnt offering throughout your generations at the doorway to the Tent of Meeting in the Lord’s presence, where I’ll meet with you to speak to you there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll meet there with the Israelis, and it is to be consecrated by my glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll consecrate the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and I’ll consecrate Aaron and his sons to serve as my priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll live among the Israelis, and I’ll be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to know that I am the Lord their God, who brought them out of Egypt so that I may live among them. I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make an altar for burning incense. You are to make it of acacia wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is to be a square, one cubit long and one cubit wide, and it is to be two cubits high, with its horns of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to overlay it with pure gold, its top, its sides all around, and its horns, and you are to make a molding of gold all around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make two gold rings for it under its molding. You are to make them on its two opposite sides, and they are to be holders for poles by which to carry it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the altar in front of the curtain that is over the Ark of the Testimony, in front of the Mercy Seat that is over the Testimony where I’ll meet with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron is to offer fragrant incense on it. Every morning when he trims the lamps he is to offer it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when Aaron sets up the lamps at twilight, he is to offer it as a continual incense offering in the Lord’s presence throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to offer strange incense, a burnt offering, or a grain offering on it, nor are you to pour out a libation on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each year Aaron is to make atonement on its horns with the blood of the sin offering of atonement. He is to make atonement on it each year throughout your generations. It is most holy to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you take a census of the Israelis to register them, each is to give a ransom for himself to the Lord when they’re registered so there won’t be a plague among them when they’re registered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what everyone who is registered is to give: half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel weighs 20 gerahs), half a shekel as a contribution to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who are registered, 20 years of age and older, are to give a contribution to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich person is not to give more, nor is the poor person to give less than the half shekel, when you give a contribution to the Lord to make atonement for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to take the atonement money from the Israelis and give it for the service of the Tent of Meeting, and it is to be a memorial for the Israelis in the Lord’s presence to make atonement for yourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to make a bronze basin with a bronze base for washing. You are to pace it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, put water in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron and his sons are to wash their hands and their feet from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they enter the Tent of Meeting or when they approach the altar to minister to make an offering by fire to the Lord, they are to wash with water so they don’t die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to wash their hands and their feet so that they don’t die, and it is to be for them a perpetual ordinance for Aaron and his seed from generation to generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to take for yourself the finest spices: 500 shekelsby weight of liquid myrrh, half as much fragrant cinnamon (250 shekels), 250 shekels of fragrant reeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 500 shekels of cassia—all according to the shekel of the sanctuary—and a hin of olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make them into a holy anointing oil, a perfume mixture made by a perfumer. It is to be a holy anointing oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to use it to anoint the Tent of Meeting, the Ark of the Testimony,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table and all its utensils, the lamp stand and its utensils, the altar of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar for burnt offerings and all its utensils, and the basin and its base.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to consecrate them and they are to be most holy. Whatever touches them is to be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to anoint Aaron and his sons, and you are to consecrate them to serve as my priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to address the Israelis and tell them, ‘This is to be holy anointing oil for me from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not to be poured out on a person’s body, nor are you to make anything like it with similar formulations. It is holy, and it is to be holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who mixes anything like it or who puts any of it on an unqualified person is to be cut off from his people.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “Take for yourself spices: stacte, onycha, galbanum, and spices with pure frankincense, all in equal amounts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make it into a fragrant incense, expertly blended, pure, and holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to grind some of it fine, and put some before the Testimony in the Tent of Meeting where I will meet with you. It is to be most holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to make the incense that you make in this formulation for your own use. It is to be holy to the Lord for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who makes anything like it to use it as perfume is to be cut off from his people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look, I’ve called Uri’s son Bezalel, grandson of Hur from Judah’s tribe
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I’ve filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, understanding, knowledge, and all kinds of craftsmanship
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to create plans for work in gold, silver, and bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for cutting stones to set them, for carving wood, and for doing all kinds of craftsmanship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Along with him I’m appointing Ahisamach’s son Oholiab from the tribe of Dan, and I’ve given wisdom to all who are skilled so they can make everything that I’ve commanded you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: including the Tent of Meeting, the Ark of the Testimony, the Mercy Seat that is on it, all the furnishings of the tent—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table and its furnishings, the lamp stand of pure gold, all its furnishings, the altar of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar for burnt offerings, its furnishings, the basin, its base,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the woven garments, the holy garments of Aaron the priest, the garments of his sons as they serve as priests,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the anointing oil, and the fragrant incense for the Holy Place. They are to make them in accordance with everything that I commanded you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to tell the Israelis: ‘You are to certainly observe my Sabbaths because it’s a sign between me and you from generation to generation, so you may know that I am the Lord who sanctifies you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to observe the Sabbath, because it’s holy for you. Whoever profanes it is certainly to die; indeed, whoever does work on it is to be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Work may be done for six days, but the seventh day is a Sabbath of complete rest, holy to the Lord. Whoever does work on the Sabbath is certainly to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelis are to keep the Sabbath to make the Sabbath observance a perpetual covenant from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a sign forever between me and the Israelis, because the Lord made the heavens and the earth in six days, but on the seventh day he rested and was refreshed.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he finished speaking with Moses on Mount Sinai, he gave him the two Tablets of the Testimony, tablets of stone written by the finger of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people saw that Moses took a long time to come down the mountain, they gathered around Aaron and told him, “Come here and make us a god who will go before us, because, as for this fellow Moses who led us out of the land of Egypt, we don’t know what has become of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron told them, “Tear off the gold rings which are in the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters and bring them to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people tore off the gold rings that were in their ears and brought them to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took them from them and, using a tool, fashioned them into a molten calf. The people said, “This, Israel, is your god who brought you out of the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar in front of it, and then he proclaimed, “Tomorrow is to be a festival to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They got up early the next day and offered burnt offerings and brought peace offerings. Then the people sat down to eat and drink, and then they got up to play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “Go down immediately, because your people whom you led out of Egypt have behaved corruptly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have been quick to turn aside from the way I commanded them, and they have made for themselves a molten calf. They have bowed down to it in worship, they have offered sacrifices to it, and they have said, ‘This, Israel, is your god who brought you out of the land of Egypt.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses, “I’ve seen these people and indeed they’re obstinate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now let me alone so that my anger may burn against them and that I may consume them, but I’ll make a great nation of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses implored the Lord his God: “Lord, why are you angry with your people whom you brought out of the land of Egypt with great power and a show of force?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should the Egyptians say, ‘He brought them out with an evil intention to kill them in the mountains and to destroy them from the face of the earth’? Turn from your anger and change your mind about the calamity against your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, your servants to whom you swore by yourself as you told them, ‘I’ll increase the number of your descendants like the stars of the heavens, I’ll give your descendants all of this land about which I have spoken, and they are to possess it forever.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord changed his mind about the calamity he had said he would bring on his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses turned and went down the mountain with the two Tablets of the Testimony in his hand, tablets which were written on both sides. They were written on one side and the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tablets were the work of God and the writing was God’s writing, inscribed on the tablets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua heard the sound of the people as they shouted, he told Moses, “The sound of war is coming from the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moses said,
“It is not the sound of a victory shout,
    and it’s not the sound of a shout of defeat,
        but it’s the sound of singing that I hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Moses approached the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, he became angry. He threw the tablets from his hands and shattered them at the base of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the calf that they had made, burned it with fire, and ground it into powder. He scattered it on the water and made the Israelis drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses asked Aaron, “What did this people do to you that you brought such great sin upon them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron said, “Sir, don’t be angry. You know the people—that they’re intent on evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told me, ‘Make a god for us who will go before us because, as for this fellow Moses who brought us out of the land of Egypt, we don’t know what has become of him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I told them, ‘Whoever has gold ornaments, tear them off.’ When they gave it to me, I threw it into the fire, and out came this calf.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses saw that the people were out of control—since Aaron had let them get out of control, something that incited ridicule from their enemies—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he stood in the gate of the camp and called out: “Whoever is for the Lord come over to me,” and all the sons of Levi gathered around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
