verses.text: He told them, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says, ‘Every man put his sword on his thigh, and go back and forth from gate to gate in the camp, and each of you kill his brother and friend and neighbor.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Levi did just as Moses told them, and about 3,000 people died that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, “You have been ordained to serve the Lord today, and you have brought a blessing on yourselves today because every man opposed his son or brother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day Moses told the people, “You committed a great sin, and now I’ll go up to the Lord, and perhaps I can make atonement for your sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses returned to the Lord and said, “Please, Lord, this people committed a great sin by making a god of gold for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, if you will, forgive their sin—but if not, blot me out of your book which you have written.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “Whoever sins against me, I’ll blot him out of my book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, go, and lead the people where I told you, and now my angel will go before you, but on the day when I do punish, I’ll punish them for their sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord sent a plague on the people because they made the calf (the one Aaron made).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “Go up from here, you and the people whom you brought out of Egypt, to the land about which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob saying, ‘I’ll give it to your descendants.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll send an angel in front of you and I’ll drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go up to a land flowing with milk and honey, but I won’t go up among you, because you are an obstinate people, and otherwise I might consume you along the way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people heard this troubling word, they mourned, and no one put on his ornaments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord had told Moses, “Say to the Israelis, ‘You are an obstinate people, and if for one moment I went up among you, I would put an end to you. Now take off your ornaments so I may decide what to do with you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Israelis did not wear their ornaments from Mount Horeb onward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses used to take the tent and set it up outside the camp at a distance from the camp, and he called it the Tent of Meeting. When anyone sought the Lord, he would go out to the Tent of Meeting which was outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses would go out to the tent, all the people would get up, and each would stand in the doorway of his tent, watching Moses until he entered the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses entered the tent, the pillar of cloud would come down and stand at the doorway of the tent while God spoke with Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the doorway of the tent, all of them would get up and prostrate themselves in worship, each one at the doorway of his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord would speak to Moses face to face just as a man speaks with his friend. When Moses returned to the camp, Nun’s son Joshua, his young servant, would not leave the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told the Lord, “Look, you have told me, ‘Bring up this people,’ but you haven’t let me know whom you will send with me. Yet you have said, ‘I know you by name,’ and also, ‘You have found favor in my sight.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, if I’ve found favor in your sight, please show me your ways so I may know you in order to find favor in your sight. And remember, this nation is your people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “My presence will go with you, and I’ll give you rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses told the Lord, “If your presence does not go with us, don’t bring us up from here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, how shall it be known that your people and I have received favor from you, unless you go with us and that we, your people and I, are distinguished from all the people on the surface of the earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “I’ll do the very thing that you have said, because you have found favor in my sight and I know you by name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “Please show me your glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God said, “I’ll cause all my goodness to pass before you, and I’ll proclaim the name ‘the Lord’ before you. I’ll be gracious to whom I’ll be gracious, and I’ll show compassion on whom I’ll show compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But,” he said, “You cannot see my face, because a man cannot see me and live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Look, there is a place near me where you can stand on the rock;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as my glory passes by, I’ll put you in a crevice in the rock, and cover you with my hand until I’ve passed by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I’ll remove my hand so you may see my back, but my face must not be seen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses, “Cut out for yourself two stone tablets like the first ones, and I’ll write on the tablets the words which were on the first tablets that you broke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ready in the morning, and come up in the morning on Mount Sinai, where you are to present yourself to me there on the top of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one is to come up with you, nor is anyone to be seen anywhere on the mountain. Also, the sheep and cattle are not to graze in front of that mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses carved out two stone tablets like the first ones, got up early in the morning, and climbed Mount Sinai, just as the Lord had commanded him. He took with him the two stone tablets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord came down in a cloud and stood there with him and proclaimed the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord passed in front of him and proclaimed,
“The Lord, the Lord God,
    compassionate and gracious,
slow to anger,
    and filled with gracious love and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He graciously loves thousands,
    and forgives iniquity, transgression, and sin.
But he does not leave the guilty unpunished,
    visiting the iniquity of the ancestors on their children,
and on their children’s children
    to the third and fourth generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses quickly bowed to the ground and prostrated himself in worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “If I’ve found favor in your sight, Lord, please, Lord, walk among us. Certainly this is an obstinate people, but pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for your own inheritance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “I’m now going to make a covenant. I’ll do miraculous deeds in full view of your people that haven’t been done in all the earth or in any nation. All the people among whom you live will see the work of the Lord, because it’s an awesome thing that I’ll do with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obey what I am commanding you today and I’ll drive out from before you the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be very careful not to make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land to which you are going, so they won’t be a snare among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, you are to tear down their altars, you are to smash their sacred pillars, and you are to cut down their sacred poles—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: indeed, you are not to bow down in worship to any other god, because the Lord’s name is Jealous—he’s a jealous God—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, you may make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land and when they prostitute themselves with their gods and offer sacrifices to their gods, someone may invite you and then you may eat some of their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to take any of their daughters for your sons. Otherwise, when their daughters prostitute themselves with their gods, they may cause your sons to prostitute themselves with their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to make molten gods for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to observe the Festival of Unleavened Bread. For seven days, at the appointed time in the month Abib, you are to eat unleavened bread as I commanded you, for in the month Abib you came out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everything firstborn belongs to me: all the males of your herds, the firstborn of both cattle and sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to redeem the firstborn of a donkey with a sheep, and if you don’t redeem it, you are to break its neck. You are to redeem every firstborn of your sons, and no one is to appear before me empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For six days you are to work, but on the seventh day you are to rest; even during plowing time and harvest you are to rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to observe the Festival of Weeks, the first fruits of the wheat harvest, and the Festival of Tabernacles at the turn of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times during the year all your males are to appear in the presence of the Lord God of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since I’m going to drive out nations before you, and enlarge your borders, and no one will covet your land, when you go up to appear in the presence of the Lord your God three times a year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to offer the blood of my sacrifice with anything leavened, nor are you to allow the sacrifice of the Festival of Passover to remain until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are to bring the best of the first fruits of the ground to the house of the Lord your God.
“You are not to boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses, “Write down these words, because I’m making a covenant with you and with Israel according to these words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Moses was there with the Lord for 40 days and 40 nights, he did not eat or drink. He wrote the Ten Commandments, the words of the covenant, on the tablets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses came down from Mount Sinai, he had the two tablets in his hand, and he did not know that the skin of his face was ablaze with light because he had been speaking with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron and all the Israelis saw Moses and immediately noticed that the skin of his face was shining, and they were afraid to come near him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses called to them, Aaron and the leaders of the congregation returned to him, and he spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterwards all the Israelis came near and he gave them everything the Lord told him on Mount Sinai as commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses finished speaking with them he put a veil over his face,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then whenever Moses would come in the Lord’s presence to speak with him, he would remove the veil until he left the Lord’s presence. When he went out, he would tell the Israelis what he had been commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelis would see the face of Moses and that the skin of his face shone; then Moses would put the veil back over his face until he went in to speak with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses assembled the entire congregation of the Israelis and told them, “These are the things that the Lord has commanded you to do:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six days work is to be done, but on the seventh day you are to have a holy day, a Sabbath of complete rest in dedication to the Lord. Anyone who does work on that day is to be executed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to light a fire in any of your dwellings on the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses told the entire congregation of the Israelis, “This is what the Lord has commanded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Take from among yourselves an offering for the Lord. Everyone whose heart is willing is to bring as an offering for the Lord: gold, silver, and bronze;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blue, purple, and scarlet material; fine linen and goat hair;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ram skins dyed red, dolphin skins, acacia wood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: oil for lighting, spices for the anointing oil and for aromatic incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: onyx stones, and stones for setting in the ephod and the breast piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Let everyone who is skilled among you come and make everything that the Lord has commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tent, its tent, its covering, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its sockets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ark, its poles, the Mercy Seat, the curtain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table, its poles, all its furnishings, and the bread of the presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the lamp stand for light, its furnishings, its lamps, and oil for the light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar of incense, its poles, the anointing oil, the aromatic incense, and the screen for the doorway at the entrance to the tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar for burnt offerings, the bronze lattice for it, its poles, and all its furnishings, the basin and its base,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hangings for the court, its pillars, its sockets, the screen for the gate of the court,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the pegs for the tent, the pegs for the court, and their cords,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the woven garments for ministering in the Holy Place, the holy garments of Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons for serving as priests.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the entire congregation of the Israelis withdrew from Moses’ presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every person whose heart moved him and all whose spirits prompted them, brought an offering to the Lord for constructing the Tent of Meeting, for all its service, and for the holy garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both the men and women came—all whose hearts prompted them—and brought brooches, earrings, rings, pendants, and all kinds of gold jewelry. Every person presented a wave offering of gold to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who had blue, purple, and scarlet material, fine linen, goat hair, ram skins dyed red, and dolphin skins brought them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who could give an offering of silver and bronze brought it as a contribution for the Lord. Also all who had acacia wood for any use in the work brought it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every skilled woman spun with her hands, and brought what she had spun: blue, purple, and scarlet material, and fine linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the women who were skilled artisans spun the goat hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders brought onyx stones and stones to be set in the ephod and the breast piece,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: spices and oil for the light and for the anointing oil and the aromatic incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each Israeli man and woman whose heart was prompted brought something as a freewill offering to the Lord for all the work that the Lord had commanded them to do through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told the Israelis, “Look, the Lord has called Uri’s son Bezalel, grandson of Hur, from the tribe of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he has filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, with understanding, and with knowledge of all kinds of work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to make artistic designs, to work in gold, silver, and bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to cut stones for setting, to carve wood, and to engage in all kinds of artistic work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he has given both him and Ahisamach’s son Oholiab from the tribe of Dan the ability to teach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has equipped them to do all kinds of work done by an engraver, designer, embroider in blue, purple and scarlet material and in fine linen, or as a weaver. They were able to do all kinds of work and were skilled designers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezalel and Oholiab and all the skilled craftsmen to whom the Lord gave wisdom and understanding to know how to do all the work in constructing the sanctuary are to do everything that the Lord has commanded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses summoned Bezalel, Oholiab, and all the skilled people to whom the Lord had given ability, including everyone whose hearts stirred them to come forward to do the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They received from Moses all the offerings that the Israelis had brought for doing the work of constructing the sanctuary, and the people continued to bring freewill offerings every morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the craftsmen who were doing all the work on the sanctuary left the work they were doing
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and told Moses, “The people are bringing much more than enough for the work that the Lord has commanded us to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses issued an order, and the message was taken throughout the camp, “Men and women, don’t bring any more offerings for the sanctuary.” The people were restrained from bringing any more,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since the material was more than sufficient for doing all the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the skilled craftsmen among the workers made the tent with ten curtains of fine woven linen, blue, purple, and scarlet material. He made them with cherubim skillfully worked into them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain was 28 cubits, and the width of each curtain two cubits. All the curtains had the same measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He joined five of the curtains together, and the other five curtains he joined together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made loops of blue material along the edge of the outermost curtain in the first set, and likewise, he made loops along the edge of the outermost curtain in the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made 50 loops in the one curtain, and he made 50 loops along the edge of the curtain that is in the second set, with the loops opposite each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made 50 gold clasps, and joined the curtains to each other with the clasps so the tent was one piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made curtains of goat hair for a tent over the tent; he made 11 curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain was 30 cubits, and the width of each curtain was two cubits; the measurements of each of the eleven curtains was the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He joined five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made 50 loops along the edge of the outermost curtain in the first set, and 50 loops along the edge of the curtain of the other set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made 50 bronze clasps to join the tent together so it would be one piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made a cover for the tent of ram skins dyed red and a covering of dolphin skins above that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made upright boards of acacia wood for the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each board was ten cubits long, and one and a half cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each board had two pegs, joined to one another, and he did this for all the boards of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the boards for the tent: 20 boards for the south side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made 40 silver sockets under the 20 boards: two sockets under one board for its two pegs and two sockets under the next board for its two pegs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the second side of the tent to the north he made 20 boards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and 40 silver sockets for them, two sockets under one board and two sockets under the next board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the rear of the tent on the west he made six boards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he made two boards for the rear corners of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were joined together at the bottom and they were connected on top, by one ring. He did this for the two of them, and they were the two corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were eight boards with their sixteen silver sockets, two sockets under each board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made bars of acacia wood, five for the boards on one side of the tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: five bars for the boards on the second side of the tent, and five bars for the boards on the back side of the tent to the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the middle bar in the center of the boards pass through from end to end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He overlaid the boards with gold, and made gold rings for them as holders for the bars, and he overlaid the bars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a curtain of blue, purple, and scarlet material, and fine woven linen. He made it with cherubim skillfully worked into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made four pillars of acacia for it and overlaid them with gold, along with their gold hooks, and he cast four silver sockets for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the doorway of the tent, he made a screen of blue, purple, and scarlet material and fine woven linen, the work of an embroiderer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and five pillars of acacia along with their hooks. He overlaid their tops and their bands with gold. Their five sockets were made of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood two and a half cubits long, one and a half cubits wide, and one and a half cubits high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He overlaid it with pure gold, inside and outside, and made a gold molding around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cast four rings for it on its four feet, two rings on one side of it and two rings on its other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a Mercy Seat of pure gold two and a half cubits long and one and a half cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made two cherubim of gold; he made them of hammered work at the two ends of the Mercy Seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One cherub was at one end and one cherub at the other end. He made the cherubim at the two ends of the Mercy Seat and of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cherubim had their wings spread upward, covering the Mercy Seat with their wings and facing each other. The faces of the cherubim were turned toward the Mercy Seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made a table of acacia wood two cubits long, one cubit wide, and one and a half cubits high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He overlaid it with pure gold and put a gold molding around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a rim one handbreadth wide around it, and made a gold molding around the rim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cast four gold rings for it and put the rings on the four corners where its four feet were.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rings were close to the rim as holders for the poles to carry the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold to carry the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the utensils which were on the table, its plates, dishes, bowls, and jars out of which libations are poured. He made them of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the lamp stand of pure gold. He made the lamp stand, its base, and stem of hammered work and its cups, calyxes, and flowers were of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six branches extended from its sides, three branches of the lamp stand from one side of it, and three branches of the lamp stand from its other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three cups shaped like almond blossoms with calyxes and flowers were on one branch and three cups shaped like almond blossoms with calyxes and flowers were on the other branch, and so on for the six branches extending from the lamp stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the lamp stand itself there were four cups shaped like almond blossoms each with their calyxes and flowers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A calyx was under the two branches that extended out of the stem; a calyx was under the next pair of branches that extended out of the stem; and a calyx was under the last pair of branches that extended out of the stem, and so on for the six branches extending from the lamp stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their calyxes and their branches were of one piece with it, all of it was of one piece of hammered work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made its seven lamps, its tongs, and its trays from pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made it and all of its furnishings from a talent of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the altar for burning incense of acacia wood, a square, one cubit long, one cubit wide, and two cubits high, with its horns of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He overlaid it with pure gold—its top, its sides all around, and its horns—and he made a gold molding around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made two gold rings for it under its molding, on its two opposite sides, as holders for poles by which to carry it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made the holy anointing oil and the pure aromatic incense, the work of a perfumer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made the altar for burnt offerings of acacia wood. It was a square, five cubits long and five cubits wide, and it was three cubits high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made horns on its four corners. Its horns were of one piece with it, and he overlaid it with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made all the utensils for the altar—the pans, the shovels, the bowls, the forks, and the fire-pans—and he made all its utensils of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a lattice, a netting of bronze, for the altar. It was under its ledge, extending halfway up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cast four rings on the four ends of the bronze lattice as holders for the poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put the poles through rings on the sides of the altar to carry it. He made it hollow, out of boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the bronze basin and its bronze base from mirrors contributed by the women who served at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made the court. On the south side the hangings for the court were made of fine woven linen, 100 cubits long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made their 20 pillars and their 20 sockets of bronze, while the hooks of the pillars and their bands were made of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The north side was 100 cubits long, and its 20 pillars and 20 sockets were made of bronze, and the hooks of the pillars and their bands were made of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the west side there were hangings 50 cubits long with their ten pillars and ten sockets. The hooks of the pillars and their bands were made of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The east side was 50 cubits long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hangings for one section were fifteen cubits long, with their three pillars and three sockets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also for the second section. On either side of the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits long with their three pillars and three sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the hangings around the court were made of fine woven linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sockets for the pillars were made of bronze and the hooks of the pillars and their bands were made of silver. Their tops were overlaid with silver, and all the pillars of the court were banded with silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The screen of the gate of the court was the work of an embroiderer of blue, purple, and scarlet material, and fine woven linen. The length was 20 cubits and it was five cubits high along its width, corresponding to the hangings of the court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their four pillars and their four sockets were made of bronze, and their hooks were made of silver. Their tops were overlaid with silver and their bands were made of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the pegs for the tent and for all around the court were made of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is a summary of materials for the Tent of Meeting that was compiled at Moses’ direction, the work of the descendants of Levi under the direction of Aaron the priest’s son Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Uri’s son Bezalel, grandson of Hur from the tribe of Judah, made everything that the Lord had ordered Moses to build.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him was Ahisamach’s son Oholiab from the tribe of Dan, an engraver, designer, and embroiderer in blue, purple, and scarlet material, and of fine linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the gold that was used in the work, in all the work on the sanctuary, including the gold from the wave offering, totaled 29 talents, 730 shekels, according to the standard used in the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The silver from those of the congregation who were recorded totaled 100 talents and 1,775 shekels, according to the standard used in the sanctuary;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a beka a head (a beka is half a shekel, according to the standard used in the sanctuary) for everyone who went through the registration process from 20 years old and older. The total numbered 603,550 bekas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One hundred talents of silver were used to cast the sockets for the sanctuary and the sockets for the curtain, 100 sockets for 100 talents, a talent per socket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with 1,775 talents he made hooks for the pillars, overlaid their tops, and made bands for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bronze from the wave offering totaled 70 talents and 2,400 shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With it he made the sockets for the doorway to the Tent of Meeting, the bronze altar, the bronze lattice for it, all the furnishings for the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sockets for all around the court, the sockets for the gate to the court, all the pegs for the sanctuary, and all the pegs for all around the court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the blue, purple, and scarlet material they made finely woven garments for ministering in the Holy Place, and they made the holy garments for Aaron, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the ephod out of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet material and fine woven linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They hammered out gold sheets and cut off threads to work into the blue, purple, and scarlet material and into the fine linen, a work of skillful design.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made connecting shoulder pieces for the ephod and attached them to its two edges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The skillfully woven band that was on it was made like it, of one piece with it: of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet material and fine woven linen, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They prepared the onyx stones, engraved with the names of the sons of Israel like the engraving on a signet, and mounted them in settings of gold filigree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as stones of remembrance for the sons of Israel, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made a breast piece, skillfully worked, like the work of the ephod: of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet material and fine woven linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the breast piece square when folded double: one span in length and one span in width when folded double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They mounted on it four rows of stones. The first row was a row of carnelian, topaz, and emerald;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the second row ruby, sapphire, and crystal;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third row jacinth, agate, and amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fourth row beryl, onyx, and jasper. They were set in gold filigree when they were mounted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stones corresponded to the names of the sons of Israel, twelve stones corresponding to their names, with the engraving of a signet, each with the name of one of the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made chains of pure gold twisted like cords for the breast piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made two settings of gold filigree and two gold rings, and they put the two rings on the two edges of the breast piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put the two gold cords on the two gold rings at the edges of the breast piece,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they attached the other two ends of the two cords to the filigree settings, and then attached them to the shoulder pieces of the ephod in front.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made two gold rings and attached them to the two edges of the breast piece, on the side of it which is toward the inner side of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made two gold rings and attached them in front, on the lower part of the two shoulder pieces of the ephod, close to the place where it’s joined, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tied the breast piece by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a blue cord so it would rest on the skillfully woven band of the ephod and so the breast piece would not come loose from the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the robe of the ephod of woven work, entirely of blue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The opening of the robe was in the middle, like the opening of a coat of mail, with a binding around the opening so it would not be torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the hem of the robe, they placed pomegranates made of blue, purple, and scarlet material and woven linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates, on the hem of the robe, all around between the pomegranates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a bell and a pomegranate, then a bell and a pomegranate, all around the hem of the robe for when the High Priest ministered, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made tunics for Aaron and his sons, woven from fine linen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the turban of fine linen, decorated head coverings of fine linen, linen undergarments of fine woven linen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sash of fine woven linen, woven of blue, purple, and scarlet material, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the medallion for the holy crown of pure gold, and they wrote on it an inscription like the engraving on a seal: “Holy to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They fastened a blue cord to it in order to fasten it on the turban above, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the work on the Tent of Meeting was completed, and the Israelis had crafted it according to everything that the Lord had commanded Moses, as they should have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought to Moses the tent, all its furnishings, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the covering of ram skins dyed red, the covering of dolphin skins, the curtain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Ark of the Testimony and its poles, the Mercy Seat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table and all its utensils, the bread of the presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the lamp stand of pure gold, its lamps (with the lamps in order), its furnishings, its oil for lighting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar of gold, anointing oil, aromatic incense, the screen for the doorway to the tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the bronze altar and the bronze lattice for it, its poles, all its furnishings, the basin and its base,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hangings for the court, its pillars, its sockets, the screen for the gate of the court, its cords, its pegs, all the furnishings for the service of the tent, for the Tent of Meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the woven garments for Aaron the priest for ministering in the Holy Place, and the garments for his sons for serving as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelis had done all the work according to all that the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses blessed them when he saw all the work and that they had completed it. They had done it just as the Lord had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the first day of the first month you are to set up the tent of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the Ark of the Testimony there, and screen off the ark with the curtain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to bring in the table and properly arrange what goes on it. Then you are to bring in the lamp stand and set up its lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to put the golden altar for incense in front of the Ark of the Testimony and then set up the screen for the doorway to the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the altar for burnt offerings in front of the doorway of the tent of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to put the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar and put water in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to set up the court all around, and hang up the screen for the gate of the court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to take the anointing oil and anoint the tent and all that is in it. You are to consecrate it and all its furnishings and it will be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to anoint the altar for burnt offerings and all its utensils. You are to consecrate the altar and the altar will be most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to anoint the basin and its base and consecrate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you are to bring Aaron and his sons to the doorway of the Tent of Meeting, and wash them with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to clothe Aaron with the holy garments, you are to anoint him, and consecrate him so he may serve me as priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to bring his sons and clothe them with tunics.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to anoint them just as you anointed their father so they may serve me as priests. Their anointing is to qualify them to belong to a perpetual priesthood from generation to generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses did everything that the Lord had commanded him, so he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so in the first month of the second year, on the first day of the month, the tent was set up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses set up the tent. He installed its sockets and set its boards in place. He inserted its bars and set up its pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spread the tent over the tent and put the covering of the tent on top of it, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the Testimony, put it into the ark, and placed the poles on the ark. He then put the Mercy Seat on top of the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought the ark into the tent, set up the curtain, and screened off the Ark of the Testimony, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the table in the Tent of Meeting, on the north side of the tent, outside the curtain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and properly arranged the bread on it in the Lord’s presence, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he put the lamp stand in the Tent of Meeting, opposite the table on the south side of the tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and set up the lamps in the Lord’s presence, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the golden altar in the Tent of Meeting in front of the curtain
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and burned aromatic incense on it, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set up the screen for the doorway of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the altar for burnt offerings at the doorway of the tent of the Tent of Meeting, and offered the burnt offering and the grain offering on it, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water in it for washing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses, Aaron, and his sons washed their hands and feet from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they entered the Tent of Meeting and approached the altar, they washed, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set up the court all around the tent and the altar, and hung up the screen for the gate of the court. And so Moses finished the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of the Lord filled the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was not able to enter the Tent of Meeting because the cloud had settled on it, and the glory of the Lord filled the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the cloud was lifted up from the tent, the Israelis would set out on their journey,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if the cloud was not lifted up, they would not set out until it was lifted up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since the cloud of the Lord was over the tent by day, and the fire was in it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel in all their journeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator
